stem: A patient with advanced carpal tunnel syndrome has numbness in digits 1â€“3 but intact sensation over the thenar eminence. Which branch explains the preserved skin sensation?

choices.A: Palmar cutaneous branch of the median nerve
choices.B: Superficial branch of the radial nerve
choices.C: Palmar branch of the ulnar nerve

rationale_correct: The palmar cutaneous branch of the median nerve arises proximal to the carpal tunnel and remains outside it, preserving sensation over the thenar eminence despite tunnel compression.

rationale_distractors.B: The superficial radial branch supplies the dorsolateral thumb.
rationale_distractors.C: The palmar ulnar branch innervates the hypothenar skin.
rationale_distractors.D: The lateral antebrachial cutaneous nerve supplies the lateral forearm.
rationale_distractors.E: The medial antebrachial cutaneous nerve supplies medial forearm skin.
